intro: Erysimum etnense, commonly known as the Etna wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the volcanic slopes of Mount Etna in Sicily. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are basal, linear, and covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. Erysimum etnense is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to bloom in harsh, alpine conditions.
